overview: Double Run Eight uses the mechanisms of a double eight camera to play with visual collisions and inversions of the resulting four frames, rearranging the image plane with forwards, backwards, and radial motion as the artistâ€™s body activates, holds, and navigates propositions of the analogue image.  The film was made with a Bell & Howell Filmo series 8mm camera from the Rod Slemmons Camera Collection currently housed at the Epiphany Center for the Arts in Chicago, as part of The Chicago Cluster Project. -KA
title: Double Run Eight
